comments.body: please not villager trades, those are already too overpowered. they should be rare from piglin trades and end ships, but common from wandering traders. this would fit their lore well, as they have traveled so much that they found them, and it would stop people from killing wandering traders on sight, even with their new, rebalanced trades.
I also suggest that ender pearls should burn in water.

Netherwart blocks are perfect blocks for use in non-vanilla gameplay. Some features (for example Salvaging of McMMO) can use this block as a special block which opens up new menus and options. This is not feasable to do on any other useful blocks as the player might activate it by accident. We actually need more useless decorative blocks which can be used by mods to add functionality.

Moved post out of header. 

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
Soya and tofu!

Interesting suggestion, but adding meat substitutes doesn't fit well in Minecraft. Making fake versions of meat for modern vegans is a very new and quite scientific thing, compared to Minecraft's more medieval setting.
There are always vegetables, and golden carrots.
i guess he mean more Vegetables and fruits such as lettuce, radish, bananas and tomatoes

Well, even if tofu has been popularized recently as a good protein source, it is really ancient (at least 1000 years old). And of course, soya and tofu are cliché but Minecraft is a simplified version of our world, they aren't going to add 36 varieties of beans... Soya seems the best one to me because it has a lot of derivative products including other meat substitutes: nattõ, tempeh, soy sauce... This means a lot of recipes! All of this could be implemented in a big food update. Speaking about meat substitutes, there is also seitan which is made from wheat, already in the game.

Now if you only want more varied food of vegetable origin, there are already posts asking for beans, nuts, greens (lettuce, spinach), peas, fruits... But I don't think this is the topic here, is it?

@MohamedWW That would make more sense in general, but he did say 'meat-based' which implies substitutes.

Also, more vegetables is a very common suggestion, meaning even if that were the meaning I would have to report it as a previously considered idea.
You don't have to kill animals to be successful in survival, even though that makes the game easier.
@mtallen78 How do you enchant your items, without leather?
You could steal other villagers' bookshelves.
Just fish for leather. Unless you're not wanting to kill even hostile mobs, then it'd be a bit harder to get string.
I like the idea, and I hope it will be a class Minecraft will put the mangrove tree in.
Kind of like hay bales.
385989139892 exactly.

Yes! The current behavior is that when a honey block is piston-moved, entities on top are moved along with it.
However, this should also work for entities that are adjacent to the honey block.
This makes sense because entities slow down when adjacent to the honey block because they stick to it, so they should get pulled along by it when it is moved, in the same way as on top of it.

Indeed!

As of Minecraft version 1.15, Mojang (now Mojang Studios) added honey blocks to the game. These won't stick to regular slime and is 1 pixel smaller (in all directions) than a normal block. Honey blocks also have the ability to pull whatever entity is on top of them.

Sadly they don't pull entities with them that stand next to them, even not if they where 'inside' the block.

Why not make the honey block do that? You could be able to slide down honey blocks while being dragged over a pit, minecarts could be pulled together with rails.
I desperately wait until this feature gets added.
I think you should be able to put grass and ferns on sand, but according to science sand is bad for plant growth for lack of nutrition, maybe it can still grow plants but makes the process slower?

I think maybe it can work like rails in a way where you Face is where it’s Directed. It can also be Curved to other sand or diagonally to a block or make it small circles if you manage to rake it in two directions.
Was just thinking this recently while trying to make a water garden. A really simple addition which could open up a lot of new build ideas.
I'd love this.  Would be useful to make plaques and gravestones too
We need this a lot. Specially the pillar, chiseled and brick variants. I didn't quite what you it the rest to be honest
They should also add glaze variants of wool and concrete
Actually a really good idea.  Would help collecting XP.

Strongly Agree: Lapis pickaxe and sword should be added. They would be able to mine the same things iron can, and but would double XP. The sword would double xp from mobs killed. They would have high enchantibility like gold, have durability between wood and stone like 90-100 uses and would deal stone tool damage.
Because this would not work in multiplayer servers.

What if dragon scales are like ore in the overworld? You could mine it from the green end blocks. Maybe you need diamond or netherite pickaxe to mine it up. A dragon scale template drops from the enderdragon.
Hallo dude
Of all the things that I want to enchant, TNT isn't one of them.
UUUUUUmmmmmmm this is a little odd. But why would we need this exactly.
So you can save space if you have two people living in the same base but your bed still looks nice.
Two beds take up the same space as one king bed. It doesn't save space, actually.
YES, this has to be added, it doesn't make sense that cows can be infinitely milked, and it would add an incentive to have more than one cow, even if you only want milk.
It could be indicated visually by changing the size of the cow's udder. Of course, there is goats now, so for them the entire mob could look thinner.

On top of this making dispensers with empty buckets interact with a cow
similar to sheep and shears.
Lots of potential for cows here

The resin could also be used as a "glue." Eliminating the edges of the glass blocks like the texture packs do. Or freezing mobs as statues (to help with collection).
It could also prevent gravity blocks from falling.
Or seal the shulkers so they can't be opened even by explosions.

Or since lately you want to have everything colored, use it as a "painting base" to tint item frames and chests

Refined resin in real life is really good fuel and to refine resin you simply need to cook it so... I think resin bricks must be the actual fuel and smelt 16 items and the brick blocks could smelt 64 items (and the slab 32 of course).
I think it is a great idea for people doing modernistic buildings!
yes !!
I think this would benefit alot of creators and i really think it should be added!

This is a great way to implement it. I was about to write a suggestion of my own for neon and then found this. I like this idea a lot. And maybe glass tubes added as well to hold the neon? And I can think of a bunch of detailing stuff glass tubes could be used for so that'd be great.

Just go see the canopy

There's already a lot of enchantments that go on the helmet. I feel this would fit perfectly on elytra.
yeah thats actually a better idea, i was thinking of helmet because you die of kinetic energy when you slam head first
Possibly could be a thing.

I can see this being a thing seeing that if u went invisible you can still be seen because of the purple aura and people can tell if you're enchanted or not but they won't know what type of armor you have on. +1 Vote
great with invisibility potion

Yeah I was thinking of this idea too! It's especially useful now as well because we could probably put it on the wolf armor, so you could see their fur! It's also not really unbalanced because you'll be able to see a person using an invisibility potion with their purple "aura". It will also allow people to see their minecraft skins.
Love it.
Fun Idea, but Dark Orange isn't a color in minecraft.
I think it's a cool idea but maybe the potion timer should be 30 sec with redstone and 10 without. Because it would be to op with 3:00
It shouldn't last long, and I feel like it should be made from something rarer, like maybe an eye of ender.

I like it, and had a similar idea! My brewing recipe was a potion of tangibility (a potion brewed with ghost shards) corrupted by a fermented spider eye. I have some ideas for mobs that could hurt you and blocks that would act solid as well, if you are interested.
well i think that it should last for 1:00 because then its not to long and not to short
well i think that it should last for 1:00 because then its not to long and not to short
